text: The National Gallery, Hotels (Raffles & Fullerton), Victoria Theatre & Concert Hall are the remarkable heritage & colonial structures in Singapore. Besides these large scale buildings, most of the iconic black-and-white bungalows are activated as exhibition halls, cafes & bars. But all around the Canterbury Park, you can still find some bungalows remained as residential properties.

Most people would know or have visited HortPark.
But there is another very tranquil place that is away from the crowd which is just next to HortPark.
And that is Canterbury Road.
It's serene, with lots of greenery, quiet road, plenty of matured trees, of which a few are given Heritage Tree status by NPark.
This area is dotted with Colonial houses that previously house officers from the nearby Gillman Barracks and Alexandra Barracks.
Canterbury with its wide open field is among the choice location for wedding couple photo shoot.

It's quite a challenge to ride my bike up the slope. 3rd attempt, I managed to successfully pedal up the slope.

Nice quite place to appreciate the old white and black houses in the area.

Beautiful trees and sceneries around this area too.
It is very windy here at night time. üëç
